result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Jon Erickson #542328 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary of a Trailer Home - PTAC, As a Party to a Crime [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to La Crosse Co. Case Nos. 13 CF 646 and 14 CF 222.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.
Defendant is to maintain employment or education.
Defendant is to have no contact with known drug users or dealers.  No possession or consumption of illicit substances without a valid and monitored prescription.
Defendant is to comply with any assessments and recommendations or programming/treatment recommended by the Department of Corrections.
